British Virgin Islands (BVI) Premier Dr. Natalio Wheatley has welcomed St. Martin's accession as it strengthens regional cooperation amid growing global challenges.

articles.title: Uttarakhand facing climate change impact at ‘twice the global rate', warn experts
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Uttarakhand is experiencing climate change impacts at almost twice the global rate, making it one of the most disaster-prone regions in India. The concerns were raised during the unveiling of the second edition of 'Making Molehills of Mountains: Tales of Uttarakhand'.

articles.title: Bihar farmers embrace climate-smart practices to combat unpredictable weather patterns
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Climate change has upended agriculture in Bihar. Farmers are fighting back with climate-resilient techniques that are reshaping the future of agriculture in the state. The traditional farming practices in Bihar have been thrown into disarray due to erratic rainfall, frequent droughts and devastating floods.

articles.title: ‘Climate-resilient farming need of hour in Bihar'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Climate change poses a serious threat to various sectors, especially agriculture in Bihar. The state's agriculture department secretary, Sanjay Kumar Agrawal, talks to TOI's Sheezan Nezami about its impact and the need for climate-resilient farming.

articles.title: 2025 SPRING FARM EDITION: An uncertain year ahead for farmers – but what else is new?
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: South Carolina Agriculture Commissioner Hugh Weathers visited Washington, DC. Weathers discusses uncertainty in agriculture, potential bright spots, labor issues, and economic aid following visits to Washington, D.C. and South Carolina's potential future in the agriculture industry.

articles.title: Residents share concerns about local climate with state environmental department
articles.author: Standard-Speaker
articles.summary: There's too much traffic and too little recycling, people said when asked about what worried them most about climate change in Hawkinston. The most common answer was traffic and recycling, followed by climate change. The least common one was the environment in general, and then the number of people recycling.

articles.title: Manitowoc outdoors report has details of a spring migration bird hike \u0026 more news
articles.author: Herald Times Reporter
articles.summary: Lifestyle Glacial Lakes Conservancy will hold a spring migration bird hike starting at 7:30 a.m. Bird-watching is the practice of observing, listening to, pursuing and admiring birds in their natural habitats. The conservancy's restoration projects and education programs depend on this funding.

articles.title: Global cooperation, humanity's only way to avert global climate crisis, says UNFCCC executive secretary
articles.author: Cheryl
articles.summary: Simon Stiell is the executive secretary of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). He believes that global cooperation is humanity's only way to avert global climate crisis. He is on a visit to China from Wednesday to Saturday. China's solar energy capacity alone exceeds the combined total of the United States and Japan.
